name: TheAtlantic
text: "Americans have reason to be hopeful, in this election and those to come, that we can avoid the failures of other countries and that the judges who hear the cases will remain faithful to their judicial oaths," @SheldonSnook writes: https://t.co/c0QrmVAcaD

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Trump won’t go away entirely, and he certainly won’t get quiet, but fewer Americans will listen to or care about what he has to say,” @GrahamDavidA writes: https://t.co/Zizqd2ONdv

name: TheAtlantic
text: This pandemic is careening out of control. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/eony6Qvwgz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: Aquarium dining in Singapore, the damaged Arecibo Observatory in Puerto Rico, increasing COVID-19 cases worldwide, a drive-through Santa experience in Los Angeles, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/vUnQ220T7I

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the next four years, the GOP could function primarily as a promotional tool for Trump—to the detriment of the party's future, writes @PeterAtlantic. https://t.co/ZgsZEdu2MS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even after the pandemic is over, the weight of these experiences will remain with us for a lifetime," Kasey Grewe writes. https://t.co/eOAEgBEzPE

name: TheAtlantic
text: How do you talk with a loved one who believes pandemic conspiracy theories? Listen to the "Social Distance" podcast: https://t.co/5QlEdTvZVH

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @juliettekayyem: On March 8th 2020, my first essay @TheAtlantic on #COVID19  was about a deadly virus, entitled "The US Isn't Ready for What's About to Happen." 

9 months later, so much tragedy. But with clear-eyed hope, my latest, "The Month the Pandemic Started To End."
https://t.co/eBnHHyjlGb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Nevada: Images of the Silver State - the 48th in a year-long photo series, focusing on each of the 50 states in the United States of America. https://t.co/gUSNVqaiBl https://t.co/QFlIFDzK05

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @peterlattman: Kasey Grewe, an intensive care doctor, filed these harrowing dispatches during the peak of the pandemic in NYC. If you need convincing as to how grave this is -- or just like good writing -- read them. https://t.co/rDbqxBREnw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Day 6 of the 2020 Hubble Space Telescope Advent Calendar: Gazing into the Lagoon. A close view of Messier 8, known as the Lagoon Nebula, a giant cloud of glowing interstellar gas 4,100 light-years away, that is also a stellar nursery. https://t.co/oVvhgBoeYW https://t.co/jlCJo7swWy

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "The United States is about to undergo a vaccination campaign at a speed never before attempted, and Americans aren’t used to seeing public policy scale up this quickly." 

Smart piece from @juliettekayyem:
https://t.co/5Tlm4y4vA7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Overwhelmed hospitals are like hospitals in war zones. A beautiful and impossibly sad essay by an anesthesiologist about how covid is “far worse than we ever imagined.” Astounding details in this story: https://t.co/57BjyCaXjy

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: Maryland Republican Gov. Larry Hogan on the GOP and its future in post-Trump era: “Successful politics is about addition and multiplication—not subtraction and division. And I’m afraid we’ve been doing an awful lot of dividing lately.” https://t.co/VVLk8moL7K

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: A New York physician’s diary entries from March and April read as a horrifying preview of what doctors nationwide face in December: https://t.co/mJEnfPb8eM

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: Georgia elections administrator:
“When we did the hand recount] we figured, okay, if we do this and it came out that good, surely this will kill the idea that these machines did something untoward. We were wrong. Facts & data don’t seem to really matter.”
https://t.co/3l6GFMcvsE

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: What responsibility does The Crown have to history? Read @helenlewis to find out https://t.co/7dgOalrFWH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The moral imperative now is to get vaccination done quickly," @juliettekayyem writes. "The new year will usher in a rolling recovery … The entire time, Americans may struggle to maintain their composure—as the inevitable snafus happen." https://t.co/LLCICWpc54

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The moral imperative now is to get vaccination done quickly," @juliettekayyem writes. "The new year will usher in a rolling recovery … The entire time, Americans may struggle to maintain their composure—as the inevitable snafus happen." https://t.co/mptfPL1uRA

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even after the pandemic is over, the weight of these experiences will remain with us for a lifetime," Kasey Grewe writes. https://t.co/wEUtMQHDf0

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Voyager spacecraft are billions of miles from home, in interstellar space, but they're still feeling the sun's influence, @marinakoren writes: https://t.co/AVVPLG8HSy
